JobFullDesc: Are you looking to advise organizations through critical and complex issues related to the capital asset lifecycle. Our clients- primarily in asset-intensive industries- trust us to provide innovation, specific knowledge, and execution related to their capital investments in real estate, fixed assets, and capital projects. Deloitte's Capital Assets Practice is comprised of passionate, like-minded enthusiasts who strive to fundamentally transform how our clients deliver value. If this sounds like you, keep reading!Work you'll doWe are looking for frontrunners in the fields of Capital Assets to help drive growth and manage delivery teams, bring subject matter expertise around compliance, strategies, processes and organizational transformation. As part of the Capital Assets Advisory team, your responsibilities will include: Work with clients to help them make financial decisions that will drive performance  Identify opportunities for process improvement and innovative approaches to completing scope of work  Act as a power system modeler within the support team leading the laboratory's analytical and forecasting work  Participate in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues.  Conduct relevant research, data analysis, and create reports  Maintain responsibility for completion and accuracy of work products  Assist in proposal development, as requested  Actively expand consulting skills and professional development through training courses, mentoring, and daily interaction with clients  Support relevant generation and transmission planning, economic analysis, price forecasting, and wholesale electricity market analysis The teamAt Deloitte, our Capital Assets team practice is part of Deloitte Transactions, Mergers & Acquisitions. They provide services that support our clients as they engage in strategic transactions and make investments to reshape their business, raise capital, and generate value for stakeholders. Learn about Advisory Careers at Deloitte Basic Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Power Systems  Experience tailoring and running power system modeling for different modeling scenarios  Familiarity with PSS/E or similar modeling platform  PreferredPrevious Professional Services experience
